Description: Ostracon, fragment (three pieces joined) from the body of a coarse red pottery vessel, interior slightly grooved and covered with slashes of an off-white deposit, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip and remains of six lines of thickly Coptic text written in black ink, now worn in places.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.78)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (372011) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/372011)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 63 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
